title.narrative: 6.2 CHILD & FAMILY SOCIAL SERVICES

description.narrative: Output 6.2: By 2018, children and adolescents at great risk of or victims of neglect, abuse or exploitation have better access to quality prevention and care services, which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection â€“ General, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 6: By 2018, children and adolescents, particularly the most vulnerable, are better protected against abuse, violence and exploitation.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 6.2: By 2018, children and adolescents at great risk of or victims of neglect, abuse or exploitation have better access toquality prevention and care services

description.narrative: In 2018, 9,347 children and adolescents at-risk or victims of violence, abuse, exploitation had access to quality care thanks to trained social workers and child protection extension services. Quality of the service, ensured by the heads of the protection who benefited from continuing training held at regional level. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019
